name: liquefying
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
liquefy
liquefy verb
(SUBSTANCE)
[ I or T ] to (cause a gas or a solid to) change into a liquid form: Gases liquefy under pressure. To liquefy it, the gas is cooled to minus 260 degrees.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter 5 or 10 minutes, the sugar will start to liquefy and form large chunks.The body was so badly decomposed it had started to liquefy.Liquefied natural gas is natural gas that has been supercooled into a liquid state.

liquefy verb
(MONEY)
[ T ]
  finance & economics
  specialized to change an asset (= something you own such as property) into money, or into an asset that can be changed into money easily: If we were to liquefy all our assets we could afford anything. Related word
liquid
More examplesFewer examples30% of the liquefied assets were used to repay other debts.Financial institutions are trying to get themselves healthy by liquefying distressed assets or assets that are trading at less than par value.
